The second phase of a capacity development programme for the new Saudi Energy Efficiency Centre to develop Energy Efficiency Policy and Regulations
Technical assistance to King Abdul-Aziz City for Science and Technology in terms of Energy Efficiency .
capital of a political entity
Energy - power generation
National Strategy Submitted to SEEC Board

comment.narrative: The Center is established and the Energy Efficiency Laws is drafted
To develop specific policies and regulations targeting industry, buildings and transport sector and to introduce labelling standards.

Several Workshops to discuss the updated energy efficiency standards with a number of government entities and International consultants and agencies; ASHARE, Saudi Custom, World Bank, Shell, International Council of Clean Transportation (ICCT) Middle East Lighting Association ( MELA( and others. In addition a database for industries, light duty vehicles fuel economy label, tires and used cars was prepared. Also an awareness campaigns through media and other mean were launched to introduce the new standards for the public. The National Energy Efficiency strategic plan should be completed at the end of 2016. Furthermore, the enforcement of the new standards for white good has started in March 2015 for Washing machines and in May 2015 for the refrigerators and freezers. This enforcement is expected to reduce the electricity consumption by up to 40%. In addition w workshop was conducted with lighting manufactures and importer to introduce the lighting standards for residential sector (SASO 2870/2015). The aerodynamic regulation for heavy duty vehicles in transportation sector has been drafted.
National Energy Efficiency Strategic Plan completed, and number of engineers and technicians are certified from accredited energy institutions and qualify national trainers in EE field.

Through mechanisms currently available, the project has been able to activate quick initiatives to rationalize energy consumption in three different sectors namely building, transportation and industry. Each initiative was being developed with the participation of an integrated national system, taking into account the preservation of the governmental authorities. The project managed to determine the current level of energy efficiency. The project conducted number of training programmes and specialized workshops in the field of rationalization and raising the efficiency of energy consumption in all cities of the kingdom.
